p: The drying conditions had a significant effect on the yield of the essential oils ( p < 0.05) ( Table 2). The yield obtained from fresh leaves of L. thymoides was similar to the yield obtained by drying for 390 min at 60 °C (0.50% on average). The highest yields were obtained for dried leaves at 40 °C and 50 °C (0.74% on average). Therefore, according to the experimental conditions here described, to achieve better yields, it is necessary to reduce the moisture content of L. thymoides leaves, but the samples should be dried at temperatures in the range of 40 to 50 °C. At higher temperatures such as 60 °C, there is a greater loss in the components by volatilization, resulting in lower yields during extraction.
